Hello to everyone. I\'ve been playing the game for about four months now, and have managed one successful landing on and return from the Mun. I\'ve had a few more successful landings and takeoffs, but either didn\'t have enough fuel to get home, or ended up in a solar orbit millions of kilometers away. It\'s been a lot of fun.

I do have an opening question, though: how can I re-center my rocket in the space center? I\'ve got it so far off to one side I can\'t work on it when it rotates around because it\'s too close, and if I try to launch it\'s on the sloped ramp and falls over and blows up. I thought perhaps exiting the game and returning would re-center the ship, but it doesn\'t. Is there a way to do this, or am I hosed?

Thanks!

Hi JamesS!

Wow, your doing pretty well. I have yet to land on the Mun. I\'m also new so I don\'t know the answer to your question, but I bet someone here does.

Cheers and welcome!

Welcome to the forums, first.

Secondly, you just move the rocket around by the capsule, and there should be some circles on the ground in the VAB. They correlate to the centre of the launch pad. Try to get above those. Have fun.

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

In addition to clicking on the capsule, you can hold shift and click anywhere on the rocket to move it.

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
